page.title: 18COUSLAND - KATEWELL QUARRY
page.content: LIMESTONE QUARRYING AND MINING HAS TAKEN PLACE IN THE COUSLAND AREA SINCE 1927. AFTER 1970, NO QUARRYING TOOK PLACE, UNTIL 1974-77. RECENTLY THE RESIDENTS OF THE AREA HAVE BEEN CAMPAIGNING AGAINST THE PROPOSALS TO START QUARRYING AGAIN, AND ARE AWAITING THE OUTCOME OF A PUBLIC INQUIRY TO BE HELD IN SEPTEMBER 1985. THE LOCAL COUNCIL'S PLANNING COMMITTEE AND THE LOCAL RESIDENTS' ASSOCIATION ARE OPPOSED TO FURTHER QUARRYING BECAUSE THERE ARE OTHER SUITABLE SOURCES OF THIS MATERIAL WHICH WOULD WASTE GOOD AGRICULTURAL LAND, THE LANDSCAPE WOULD BE UNPLEASANTLY ALTERED, THE RURAL ROADS WOULD BE OVERUSED AND THE NOISE AND DUST WOULD SPOIL THE AMENITY OF THE VILLAGE.
